headline: Easy Turkey Tetrazzini
description: Turkey Tetrazzini turns leftover turkey into a quick crowd-pleaser. This creamy casserole version uses egg noodles for comfort and celery soup for speed.

video.description: This simple dish features leftover turkey in a creamy noodle casserole.
video.name: Easy Turkey Tetrazzini

name: Easy Turkey Tetrazzini
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add noodles and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Meanwhile, melt butter in a large heavy skillet. Drain mushrooms, add to skillet, and cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Stir in turkey, condensed soup, sour cream, salt, and pepper.
Drain noodles and place in a 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour turkey mixture evenly over the top. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Didn't really get saucy enough to bubble. A bit dry. I would probably add 1/4 c of liquid, such as milk or chicken broth

This IS incredibly easy for a tetrazzini dish- I had it prepared in no time. I eliminated the mushrooms because of personal taste. Because tetrazzini is one of our favorite dishes, it is not fair to compare this side-by-side with a more complex recipe; therefore, I can say only that I found this to have too little sauce for the noodles. By the time they are baked, you have a very heavy noodle dish that has little taste. You also have the possibility that your noodles, will dry up. I have found this to be true more than once. I recommend doubling the sauce component or significantly cutting back on the noodles and baking it in a smaller casserole dish. This is a 3-star as written, and a 4-star once you adjust the ingredients for dryness. I only leave it at 4 because there is very little taste to this and it could benefit from more spicing.
Vergy good. I used fresh mushrooms and added 1/2 cup water per the suggestions.
Great recipe - I substituted nofat Turkey Gravy for the soup as it was in my pantry. Also added diced red onion sauteed with the fresh mushroom vs canned.

Good and simple! A tad dry for us, I ended up pouring a little light cream over halfway through baking. Next time I’d add 1/2 c milk to mixture beforehand. We used shredded turkey and fresh mushrooms, both which I seared for flavor. We seasoned with thyme, parsley, celery seed, white pepper, and onion flakes then topped with buttery panko and parm for crunchy topping. Base recipe is good, but make it your own!
delicious and pretty simple ...

So easy! After reading the reviews, I decided to add a can of low sodium cream of mushroom and half a cup of milk. I used 1-2 lb of spaghetti and the consistency was perfect. When I serve it, I sprinkle some French fried onions on top! Excellent!
Easy as pie. Still in the oven.

So good! I followed the suggestions in the comments and added a half a can of water, as well as 1/2 tsp each of garlic powder and onion salt (and consequently reduced the salt to 1/2 tsp.) I also added a cup or so of peas to the noodles before pouring on the turkey mixture. This recipe was a total hit in our household!

This recipe was so good and so easy. I didn't have any mushrooms, so I added onions and celery baked it in a cast iron skillet. Had company and they loved it as well. We nearly devoured the whole dish! LOL

I was pleasantly surprised just how easy and tasty this was! It was perfect for our left over turkey, especially after eating sandwiches and still having turkey left. I didn't have egg noodles so I used angel hair pasta. I followed everything as written, it was very tasty but I'm a big caper fan so I added a couple of tablespoons of them. I highly recommend. Wish I had taken a photo but we dug into it as soon as it came out of the oven.
I added celery for crunch, removed mushrooms (allergy), and added some onion powder for depth.

This was pretty good, easy and quick. I took advise from others and sauteed some onion and garlic with the mushrooms. I also added some chicken broth to the mixture to give it a better consistency. I think it needs a bit more flavor; will consider some other spices and adding a bit more onion and garlic next time.

I've made this dish before, but this recipe was the best! I added about 1/4 diced onion & 1/2 tsp of garlic to the sauteed mushrooms, and also mixed in a little shredded mozzarella as well as on top with parsley, before putting in the oven. So good!! This is a keeper!

Thanksgiving at my house means putting people to work, so there will always be leftover chopped onion and celery that didn't get used up, along with leftover turkey, stored in ZipLock bags waiting to be used in a casserole. Frankly, this tetrazzini benefits from a few aromatics, so use them if you've got them. Also, other suggestions to add a 1/2 broth is also recommended. Otherwise, outstanding recipe!

Definitely needs more liquid. I would add either milk or broth. 1/2 cup to a cup at least. Otherwise, it's a great recipe. Everybody has different likings. I would have liked it to be more creamy. I did double the recipe and added a can of cream of mushroom, as well as more sour cream. Also, bread crumbs on top with the fresh grated parmesan would have been incredible. Make it your own.
One of my all time favorites. Quick and easy.
The ingredients are easy to pick up at the store. It was real quick easy fix for my family. This recipe was delicious and we want more! I did add some Monterey Pepper Jack cheese on top.

Been using this recipe for years. I always double it-up and throw the 2nd batch in the freezer. The only tweak I make is using fresh 'shrooms and sprinkle a couple tblsp of red wine in while sauteeing in the butter. Once the wine begins to reduce, I like to put a shallot and chopped clove of garlic in the mix before adding the "wet" stuff for the sauce. Total comfort food.
This is by far the easiest...and not too cheesy...left over turkey dish. My family was thrilled; this will be a repeat recipe after each turkey :)
We made it after Thanksgiving with the left over turkey. Now we substitute turkey with chicken. Still great and easy. Leftovers are even better.
Made it and everyone really liked it. 👍🏻 It was GREAT to eat up some of that leftover turkey!

This recipe is super easy and worked out well with a few minor changes. I used less about half the salt the recipe called for because there is already salt in the soup mix and I used an italian cheese blend instead of parmesan. I also added a can of peas to get some extra veggies in.

I love this recipe. Quick to make and taste great.

I use my Instant Pot. I do not include the mushrooms because my family does not like them.

I dump the water, I added 1/4 extra water because it was dry a couple of times I made it.

Dump in the soup and butter and mix well, saute mode on the Instant Pot helps warm the soup so it mixes in well.

I strip the salt because the turkey had enough salt. Made this once with smoked turkey - it was really good.

Pressure cook on high for 3 min (based on 10 min on the egg noodle packages if using a pot of water). Let natural pressure release for 5 min.

Mix in about 1/2 parmesan cheese and sour cream.

Top with 1/2 cup of parmesan then I use the crisper top for the Instant Pot to bake at 375 for 10 to 15 min.

One pot to clean. Supper quick meal.

Great easy meal
Next time add in some steamed broccoli

This recipe was very easy. I appreciated that since it was a last minute decision and I had all the ingredients. It was a little bland tasting, I e we I understand add something to spice it up next time. Maybe read some of the other reviews fir ideas.

Added sauted onions, 2 cloves of chopped garlic, kale and chopped celery along with 2 cups turkey broth, 1/2 cup sour cream and can of cream of mushroom soup. Plus threw in the last of leeks cooked under the turkey. Topped with 1/2 cup of Italian bread crumps and 1/2 cup of parm cheese blended for a topping.
Easy and tasty, add some spices (sage, thyme, rosemary) to punch up the flavor.
Very easy to make, this was an excellent use of leftover turkey. Used fresh mushrooms instead of canned and it came out great.
Subbed peas for mushrooms. Added a little oregano. Delish!

Only added some early spring peas.
 Oh so yummy.
My family's favorite left-over turkey recipe! :-)
I substituted Cream of Mushroom soup for the Cream of Celery and added a little garlic powder. It was quick, easy and delicious!
My husband loved it. I substituted GF fettuccine pasta for the egg noodles and had to bake it 10 more minutes to get it to brown. Definitely a great comfort food.
I add 1/3 cup of white wine and sour cream made it creamer

I made this recipe and without checking to make sure I had the ingredients, oops, no sour cream, Or my pantry staple, Cream of Celery soup! Okay, substitution time! 
So for the Cream of Celery Soup, Add to the Mushroom flavor by using Cream of Mushroom with Garlic worked great. And as a substitution for the Sour Cream, I really had to think about this one. No Yogurt available without fruit at least, so I decided to use 8oz Cream Cheese. It has the nice tang similar to Sour Cream so I cut it up small, added it in the other hot ingredients and added enough Whole Milk to get to the desired consistency, apx. 1/2 Cup, and mix it all in. IT Tastes Fantastic! I also added a can of drained Peas. This recipe gave me other ideas like instead of using the Noodles, add it to a layer of hot but not fully baked Tater Tots. 
I’m sure the original recipe is delicious but if you are in a bind, like me, give it a try, who knows, you may have a Double Header!

We did make a few changes based on what others said. We used 16 oz. of sliced fresh mushrooms which we sauteed in butter beforehand. And the sauce was very thick so we added a soup can of cream. Otherwise this was an excellent recipe. Very delicious.
This was a terrific and easy recipe. Next time we have decided we will add peas to it to add a vegetable.
Sautéed 1/2 a chopped onion, fresh mushrooms, and celery. Used cream of mushroom soup and added a can of chicken stock.

I adjusted the recipe to help with the dryness and bland flavor other reviewers mentioned. I reduced the noodles to 6 oz and added 1/2 soup can of milk. I also added 1/2 large onion, chopped and approx 1/2 T. jarred minced garlic to 4 oz fresh sliced mushrooms (instead of canned) which I sautéed with 1 T. butter and 1 T. olive oil and a little salt and pepper. I omitted the additional salt and pepper and combined all ingredients before putting in the baking dish. I baked covered for 25 min and uncovered for an additional 10 min to avoid crispy noodles. My husband loved the result - score!!

Wish I'd read the reviews before making this! Very dry. Liquid did not make it to the noodles. Recipe should also make it clear whether or not to drain the mushrooms. Also needed more seasoning. I've made much better by winging it without a recipe. Wish I had this time.
We added half a cup of parmesan cheese to the mixture and mixed buttered bread crumbs to the parmesan cheese for the top
So easy and yummy!!! I chopped celery and sauteed in the butte. Added half mascarpone cheese with half sour cream. Absolutely divine!!! Will make this again.
My family ate it, but it was super, super dry!
Made it just as written, I didn't expect it to be quite as good as it was.
Loved this recipe!! It turned out great....I think the only modification was I added more mushrooms....I think 8oz instead of 6oz....my husband went back for thirds it turned out so good!!
very good! I added about 1 cup of pasta water to the creamy sauce based on others saying it was dry. I also used Rigatoni noodles since that was what I had. It was perfect.
easy, added some fresh basil to the recipe then baked. will make again

Have made this twice now (with homemade gravy added) for my family and each time it is gobbled up! I added cheddar cheese the first time because it is all I had and it was delicious!? I reheat my gravy on the stove and then add the cream of celery and sour cream and/or Greek yogurt. I also added some Parmesan and cheddar cheese to the sauce before mixing it with the noodle and turkey. Then topped with more shredded Parmesan.

Really yummy! Other reviews said to double soup and sour cream but i thought that might be too much so i added about 1 cup milk and simmered the sauce a bit and thought it was great! I also sautéed some onions with the mushrooms... I was also going to add some frozen peas but forgot... next time!!!

This was ok with using 2 cans of soup and more spices. I made it as directed other than the extra can of soup as suggested by other reviewers. I think it would turn out better if the noodles were stirred into the sauce instead of placing them on the bottom and pouring the sauce on top. The cooking times were accurate. I actually prefer the Chicken or TurkeyTetrazzini Deluxe on this site, for the flavour.

Great recipe! I followed others suggestions using 2 c. of sour cream and 2 cans of condensed cream of mushroom soup. I also used fresh mushrooms, onions and minced garlic. Added frozen peas, celery salt, paprika and Panko breadcrumbs with the Parmesan cheese. Will definitely make again and again! Great for turkey leftovers. Thank you!

Great with the changes others made. I sauteed mushrooms and onions in 2 tsp butter and some canola oil, adding garlic at the end. I used 2 cans of cream soup, 3/4 can of water, and 8 oz of plain Greek yogurt (in place of sour cream to be healthier).
Very simple, and it tastes so much richer than i expected it to (in a very good way). It was a creative and delicious way to re-use the Christmas Eve Turkey.
This was very good and easy. I added a cup of frozen peas & carrots combo. I also used fresh mushrooms.

Turkey tetrazzini is a great way to use up Thanksgiving leftovers. I took off a star because this recipe took quite a few changes though. A recipe should work on its own without needing changes. Some of these were necessary, some not, and I didn't want to go to the store to get anything. I swapped cream of celery for cream of mushroom soup, because I used up my mushrooms in Thanksgiving's green bean casserole. It would have been better with the mushrooms though. I also sautéed half an onion, a couple os stalks of celery, and some minced garlic to add more flavor. I knew the recipe as is would turn out dry, so I added an can size amount of broth that I had made from the turkey. Whenever I make noodle casseroles, I don't like mushy bland noodles, so I only cooked them to a bit firmer than al-dente and let them soak up juices in the oven. I had bowtie pasta on hand, but just about any noodle or pasta will work. To use up leftover veggies, I added about a cup each of peas and shredded carrots. We like cheese, so I added all of the parmesan directly into the casserole. After the initial 30 minutes of baking, I topped with shredded mozzarella and bread crumbs and baked another 10 minutes. Great way to use leftovers and clean out the fridge!
I added onions with the mushrooms and bread crumbs on the top. Delicious!!!

In the spirit of using up leftover turkey from thanksgiving I also added leftover carrots thinly sliced, celery, 2 small onions, and an assortment of peppers. I thought I was doubling the sauce but when I went to make it noticed it was only 8 oz of egg noodles, well I had a full pack that’s 16 oz and proceeded. This wasn’t dry at all. Had to use cheddar instead of Parmesan due to what I had but it was so good. It will likely be a year before I make it again but a great way to use leftovers. Thank you.

My family loved it. I started by sautéing celery, onion and garlic...then the mushrooms. Used 2 cans mushroom soup and about 1/4 cup half and half. Topped Parmesan cheese with Panko breadcrumbs prior to baking. The teenager in the house is going to take it in her lunch in a thermos - that’s a HUGE WIN!
No mushrooms, added a can of water with the soup. Turned out great!
I used fresh mushrooms rather than can mushrooms.

This was delicious with a few substitutions both out of necessity and to add flavor. I did not have cream of celery. I used cream of chicken and substituted celery salt for regular salt. I sauteed about a cup of a frozen mix of sauteed onion, celery and green pepper (did not need the green pepper). I put 1/2 of the parmesan into the mix along with some mozzarella and put the remaining on top with a mix of 1/2 a sleeve of Ritz crackers. I dotted the top with butter and baked it in a deeper dish. It took approximately 30 minutes to be perfect and soooo yummy. No green pepper next time. Many have commented that this recipe is dry. It could have used a little more moisture. I imagine a cream of mushroom soup added would be perfect.

Excellent foundation to personalize. Thanks to many excellent suggestions to take it to the next level.
I prepared my sauce first and let it simmer to build the flavours while I did the pasta. Sauteed the mushrooms, onions and then the garlic. Added one can of cream of chicken and one cream of celery and some globs of sour cream. A bit of milk to thin it out just a bit and 2 TBSP sherry. Salt and pepper and 1 heaping teaspoon of poultry seasoning. Added in my 2 cups of chopped turkey and let it simmer while I did the pasta.
After dumping the sauce on the pasta I sprinkled panko on top, finely shredded Parmesan and bit of Asiago. 
Baked at 350º for 30 minutes. Mmmmmm!!!

I do saute an onion and garlic before adding other sauce ingredients. I have made it with noodles or fettucini.
Very good.
Another time I added about 1 1/2 c. of cooked peas and didn't have cream of celery soup so I used cream of chicken and sauteed 2 finely chopped celery stalks with the onion and garlic. Also added a shake of celery salt and 1/2 t. of Mrs. Dash. I increased the creaminess and moisture by using about 6 half & half pods and mixed with some parmesan into the noodles.
Delicious use for turkey leftovers!! The only change I made was adding 4 cloves of chopped garlic to the mushrooms prior to sautéing. Huge hit for the whole family!!

I have made this as written but the family found it a little dry. I felt it would benefit from more sauce, while at the same time, I did not want to significantly increase the condensed soup. We also prefer a crunchier topping. So, we add the chopped and sauteed onion, garlic, celery too, a healthy splash of milk (or cream, yum!), some peas, a little extra salt, plenty more pepper, and finally, add Panko tossed with melted butter to the topping. These small changes make the perfect Tetrazzini for us. :) Thank you very much for a great start at an excellent and easy Turkey Tetrazzini!!
Added onion and garlic to mushrooms while sauteing. Added 1/2 can milk to sauce. Would have used fewer noodles.

I am making this again for the 2nd time. I wasn't sure how it would turn out the first time but it is a keeper. The first time I made it was with turkey after Thanksgiving. It was so good. We haven't made a turkey, so I bought some turkey breast and am currently roasting it to make this dish. I will be doubling the ingredients this time, using cream of celery soup and cream of chicken soup. I also use about 3/4 to 1 can of milk to help with creaminess. I read other reviews and did that the first time. I make roasted green beans with bacon and onion as a side dish. There were no leftovers last time. Making double to (hopefully) have leftovers this time. With two growing teenage boys, nothing much goes to waste:)
Made this with cream of mushroom as I was out of cream of celery and it was delicious even with the change. I doubled the sauce as others recommend. Everyone loved it!

I made this after Thanksgiving with my leftover turkey. After reading the reviews, I added a few things like extra sour cream and mushroom soup. I am planning to cook it with leftover Christmas turkey. I may add more things like broccoli this time. Quick and easy the way I like when cooking. Yum Yum!!

I made this but made my own cream of onion soup. Also I made a double batch to save for leftovers. It's pretty good I added peas to mine as it made it a complete meal. Will put this in the box for future use. Thanks.
It was good. A little too salty. I think next time I'll use panko bread crumbs on top instead of Parmesan cheese.
Really good, the family loved it! Will make again. Was a little dry, but not bad. I used smoked turkey from Thanksgiving and I think this helped it from being too bland. Thanks for sharing!!

This was really good to use up the leftover turkey from thanksgiving. I added/changed two things. First I used fresh mushrooms rather than canned but sautéed them just as the recipe called for and I added about a cup of frozen peas and carrots mix. Otherwise I followed the recipe. Family loved it! I will definitely make this again when I have some leftover turkey or chicken.
This was so easy and so good. I'll make it again and again, and perhaps using chicken in place of turkey. I can only wonder what it might taste like with leftover ham.

Quick and easy. I added garlic and chopped onions it turned out great. I also used fresh mushrooms and French fried onion rings. 
Next time I make I’ll add a 1/2 cup of water, I thought it was a little dry but everyone thought it was great!
This was wonderful! I sautéed fresh mushrooms and an onion in 4 Tbs of butter and then added some sherry. Besides that I followed it exactly and my toddler was even gobbling it it!
Used homemade noodles and used plain yogurt instead of sour cream. Added a little milk to moisten it a little. The turkey was a smoked turkey breast. It was delicious.
Pretty tasty dish however I thought it was lacking a little something. I took other suggestions and used garlic, onion and fresh mushrooms. I also used the soup on hand which was Cream of Mushroom.
Great use of leftover turkey and easy weeknight dinner

This was a good jump start. I didn't have some of the ingredients so had to improvise...sautéed celery, onion and garlic in butter, (sadly no shrooms)browned a bit of flour in the butter mixture then added warm milk to make a cream sauce with poultry seasoning, mustard powdr, smoked paprika and a bit of chicken bouillon...followed by a tad bit of nutmeg. Simmered for about twenty minutes while I was boiling the pasta and chopping the turkey. I added leftover turkey gravy for the sour cream and forgot the parm but added a splash of sherry per suggestions. Baked at 350 for 25 min then added the last of the FF onions for another 5 minutes. BF loved it!

Very good after reading reviews I adapted to make creamier. Dryness was a common complaint. I added 1 can English peas, can of cream of mushroom on top of the can of celery, added garlic salt and added an extra cup of sour cream with a 1/2 cup sharp cheddar mixed in

I'm constantly looking for ground turkey recipes and found this works well substituting cooked ground turkey for the leftover roasted turkey. I added finely chopped onion, celery, and garlic when I browned the ground turkey. It added a little more bulk. Oh, and adding a splash of Sherry takes it to a higher level. Family favorite.

So easy and delicious. Being a bit concerned with starchy carbs, I substituted spiraled squash for the pasta. I let the squash steam for a few minutes, then did the rest of the recipe as written. Big hit and glad I have more for another night this week!

It is a great comfort food and a quick meal to make. I added an extra can of condensed soup and I added an onion. I used cream of celery and cream of mushroom soup. I did not actually use fresh mushrooms for this dish. I had a few extra seasonings that I like to add most of the time (basil, oregano, and parsley). I chopped up turkey deli meat and it turned out well. I would make this dish again :)
Super easy and yummy!
I made it without mushrooms for the kiddos. I think the only thing I will change next time is more cheese, and different kinds of cheese.
Come on, if you are going to "revise" any recipe then dont give it any rating... write your own. We are looking for the ratings of the recipe posted!! I like how this turned out as is..
We really liked it!

Made it, and we both loved it, with the following changes. Used brown rice fusili pasta, and Amy's organic mushroom bisque with porcini mushrooms. Sauteed 1 medium onion, and 3 cloves of garlic, added fresh crimini mushrooms, then chicken and soup and sour cream, along with about 3 tbsp. of Marsala wine for flavor. Cooked it a little less than the max. time, as the mixture was already bubbling. Very nice, somewhat complex flavors.
Super disappointed in a bland recipe. Even my husband wouldn’t eat it... :(
YUK....and I'm easy to please. I roasted a turkey and used fresh mushrooms. Made several large baking trays for a party. Boring, pretty tasteless, and such a huge waste of money
Made it 2 times in two weeks
I made this as written delicious & easy.
I used rigatoni for the pasta and it was delicious!
It was too dry for us. When I added a second can of soup and more sour cream it was good.
It was delicious I added onion and peas and carrots, we could not get enough!
Bland - I’m used to a spicier version so I added red peppers and a little cayenne. That helped.

I don't usually make recipes with soup, but I needed something simple for hubby to make. We added fresh mushrooms rather than canned, which added more flavor. Make sure that the noodles are well-covered with sauce or they get dry.
